Message.Title: European Social Programs & Ours
Message.Msg: Comparing health care in the United States to Obamacare, the European System and our Socialized Program. A person is in need of health care, and does not have any doctors, or may even be in another city. What do they do, go the the nearest emergency room of course. They get in to the streams of care, slowing that of others. They are given the care they need to stabilize, or remedy there needs. Well, without insurance,or money, we the people who have health insurance each get charged more so the hospital gets their money. In a non-socialized responsible system everyone would be have to carry insurance, just like driving a car. This would be the fair responsible solution. Instead we have an unfair Socialized one where the responsible are paying more, due to these free loaders. In Europe they pay higher taxes, higher cost of Petro, and get free healthcare, and education based on their abilities. All the people are better off, except for the Insurance Companies that used to screw you out of services you thought you were covered for.

I'm sorry Minnie, but you should look it up. Barry has said very clearly, several times. He believes, even his Energy Secretary has said so also, that they prefer higher gas prices here, much closer to those of Europe. The only problem, which he isn't saying much about, is oil/gas peaking right before his re-election. Clearly, he has said that we should stop subsidizing oil, many times. He wants to subsidize algae, and other hair brain schemes. I believe as Romney, we should have an all out approach. We should do everything we can to make America energy independent.

Topic.Title: MITT ROMNEY IS MORMON... vs. OBAMA IS CHRISTIAN

Message.Msg: I personally do not chose abortion. I would recomend adoption. If it is definitly known a newborn will be a mass burdon on society, I would recommend the parents decide. If it would cost the remainder of society money, I would vote for abortion, the Eskimos, Indians, Viking, and most societies have done the same. If one has the money, or chooses to care for the individual let them. As a Christian, abortion policy, birthcontrol, for birthcontrols sake, should follow church guidelines. Our churches have failed us, and helped make it a political issue. More sinner makes for more business. In fact that is why the Vatican has decided we are not alone, maybe for the same reason. If our Government is involved it would only be to regulate, and license providers capable of providing safe, women's health services. This would be on a personal health card to prevent abuse. Regarding the GOP they use it as a hot button issue. Why, because their tent is becoming smaller. Look at them mostly rich, or think their rich white people as voters. They need the relgious right, for their support and vote. I personally feel they never really plan on stopping abortion, for they will lose support. It is like a cure for cancer, let's treat it instead of preventing it. A Christian is a sinner that knows he is, and believe most the the people also have a dark side. He tries to do unto other as they do unto him. Life is sacred, all life, rich, poor, or powerful. I am a pragmatic Christian, who is disappointed with the reason's I feel many are Christian. They, are purely in it for their own benefits. I have been near death, three times, I am not afraid of death. Once, the first time I truly did not want to come back. A true Christan, or ______religion should not have a fear of death.

... “Unlike the Obama's the Romney's did not have it easy when they started out. The Obama's are out of touch with America having never faced the struggles that most Americans face.” – fake ricky with the L Dude, just putting nonsense together doesn’t mean it’s remotely true, or that you’re influencing anyone at all. You are beyond delusional and look hideously foolish. Right, Mitt had it really tough, growing up in the ghettos of Bloomfield Hills, Michigan, and having to fight it out in the ‘hood at Cranbook Preparatory School. His dad became Governor when Mitt was only 15. I’m sure a 3 time Governor and CEO of American Motors didn’t leave much inheritance to pass on - probably just an old Nash Rambler and a savings bond. He also said earlier this year, that he didn’t inherit any money from his father. But then he qualified that: “What I got from my parents when they passed away I gave away to charity and TO MY KIDS.” “Passing your inheritance on to your children is not the same as not inheriting money at all. And it actually makes me a bit curious: a common estate-tax reduction strategy known as a dynasty trust relies on skipping generations. Did Romney pass on his inheritance to his kids for tax reasons? It's hard to know without seeing his tax returns—and that's another reason why he should release them.” – Nick Baumann, Mother Jones So, in your eyes, he’s a self-made man. Let’s see how he did that, and what you, some dipstick in a cubicle at minimum wage, is defending: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rodifJlis2c

This is Robert Reich's beliefs: "Political and philosophical stances Official Department of Labor portrait of Robert Reich In an interview with The New York Times, he explained that "I don't believe in redistribution of wealth for the sake of redistributing wealth. But I am concerned about how we can afford to pay for what we as a nation need to do."[22] In response to a question as to what to recommend to the incoming president regarding a fair and sustainable income and wealth distribution, Reich said, "Expand the Earned Income Tax Credit — a wage supplement for lower-income people, and finance it with a higher marginal income tax on the top five percent. For the longer term, invest in education for lower income communities, starting with early-childhood education and extending all the way up to better access to post-secondary education."[22] Reich is pro-union, saying "Unionization is not just good for workers in unions, unionization is very, very important for the economy overall, and would create broad benefits for the United States."[23][24]" He is completetly leftist in his thinking and politics! Why would anybody believe he would he would accept any moderate view?s
